intro: Chrysocoma paniculata, commonly known as the yellow star grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, erect stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its fibrous roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Chrysocoma paniculata thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in grasslands and woodland areas.
